definitions.definition: coat or mark (something) messily or carelessly with a greasy or sticky substance.
examples: his face was smeared with dirt
synonyms: dirty; Moreinformalsplotch; literarybesmear "the table was smeared with grease"

definitions.definition: spread (a greasy, oily, or sticky substance) over something.
examples: Barbara smeared peanut butter on a slice of bread
synonyms: grease; Moreliterarybedaub "smear the meat with olive oil"spread
slick; apply; literarybesmear "she smeared sunblock on her skin"

definitions.definition: messily blur the outline of (something such as writing or paint); smudge.
damage the reputation of (someone) by false accusations; slander.
examples: someone was trying to smear her by faking letters
synonyms: slur; Moreinformaldo a hatchet job on; formalcalumniate
impugn; literarybesmirch "they are trying to smear our reputation"

definitions.definition: a mark or streak of a greasy or sticky substance.
examples: there was an oil smear on his jacket

definitions.definition: a sample of material spread thinly on a microscope slide for examination, typically for medical diagnosis.
examples: the smears were stained for cryptosporidium

definitions.definition: a false accusation intended to damage someone's reputation.
examples: the media were indulging in unwarranted smears
synonyms: calumny "they printed smears about his closest aides"
